author: Submitted photo
title: Unionville woman claims $250,000 lottery prize | Local News | ottumwacourier.com
text:
Close Susan Ellison of Unionville recently won $250,000 in the Iowa Lottery's "Lucky 7 Bonus" scratch game. She bought the ticket at Casey's on West Mary Street in Ottumwa, and said she and her husband will build a new home this year with the winnings.
Submitted photo
Unionville woman claims $250,000 lottery prize Jan 9, 2025 Jan 9, 2025 Susan Ellison of Unionville recently won $250,000 in the Iowa Lottery's "Lucky 7 Bonus" scratch game. She bought the ticket at Casey's on West Mary Street in Ottumwa, and said she and her husband will build a new home this year with the winnings.
Submitted photo
CLIVE â€” Unionville resident Susan Ellison recently won $250,000 playing the Iowa Lottery's "Lucky 7 Bonus" scratch game, and plans to build a new house with her winnings.
Ellison purchased her winning ticket at Casey's located at 504 W. Mary St., and claimed her prize Wednesday at the lottery's headquarters in Clive.
"We've both (Ellison and her husband) have worked hard all of our lives and this is not something that I expected," she said in a press release.
Ellison said she and her husband will build a new home on their rural, wooded property where they live. The 55-year-old works in customer service at a manufacturing facility, though she still has a few more years to work.
"So now comes the decisions of what type of house plans to go within and where to actually situate it. It'll be fun," she said. "This is just a really nice way to start the year 2025. Hopefully by the end of 2025, we'll actually be in our new home that will last us the rest of our lifetimes."
Lucky 7 is a $20 scratch game that features 20 top prizes of $250,000, 76 prizes of $10,000 and overall odds of 1 in 2.88.
